Openglad loaded all the tile images and sprites when the program
started but only loaded the specific map's scen and pix files when
they were needed (specifically, I think it was when the player pressed
"Go").

I generated some JPGs of the game's graphics for you. You can get at
them at: http://snowstorm.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/snowstorm/openglad-e/trunk/pix/jpg/
or just check out the openglad-e svn repository and look in
trunk/pix/jpg. The PNGs in the directory above that (trunk/pix) have
actual transparency instead of the pink color, so if there's some way
you can work with PNGs, they'll probably be a bit easier. I used 100%
quality on the jpegs and PNGs are lossless, so those should be more or
less how FSGames drew them.

Good luck!
- Zardus

> On Sun, Jun 22, 2008 at 10:29 PM, alternate_dph <alternate_dph@...> wrote:
>> I'm hoping by the end of this week to have things set where we can
>> view real maps. I'm still very interested in anyone coming along to
>> supply better versions of the map tile graphics in gif format.
>> Currently, my choices are either gif or jpg for the way that Java is
>> reading them in. I'm hoping to allow scrolling of the maps pretty soon.
>>
>> --- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, Bjorn Hansen <grethel@...> wrote:
